Reviews.Title: “Great location... that's it”
Reviews.Author: Lei811
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent. Close to shopping and dining areas. About 5-minute walk to train station. Hotel is very basic, it's ideal for someone looking for a place to spend the night. It's clean, but again very basic. No services are offered other than breakfast in the morning and room cleaning service once a day. The hotel has no restaurant or bar. Parking is on the street, but I think this is the case for most of the hotels in this area. It's an old building, so the floors creak when you walk. Oh, and the bed is possibly the hardest bed I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Family Adams Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Serial_Dealer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Astrid is rather a pension than a hotel. It is located in the beautiful area, full of high street shops, elegant restaurants and is extremely well connected to the public transports. However, the beauty of the area vanishes as soon as you cross the threshold of the building. The first impression is entering the Adam's Family house...dark and aged. Wooden stairs are creaking at every step, elevator is the old fashioned one and the pavement is covered by the old and consumed carpets, giving impression to be a container for the dust rather than an element of embellishment. We had a large room on the second floor, with 4 beds. Beds and the furniture were recently renewed, thus they were fine, except that one of my daughters was complaining about the pillow being too soft. TV set was large and worked fine. Pavement was recently renewed too, but funny stuff is that it was renewed partially, just shortly under the beds, thus circa 40 cm below the beds was still covered by the old carpets...It was quite odd, rather then disturbing. My strongest objection regards the bathroom, which was made subsequently and the odd thing is that in the room larger than 36m2 they made a bathroom of 1,2 m2 including shower box, washbowl and wc. There was not space to put the toiletry, clothes taken off. I was leaving my cloths on the WC cover.. Just imagine that it was a room for 4 person with so small bathroom. Outside the bathroom, you could play a football in the room as spacious it was. Breakfast was quite good, with the limited choice of the goods, but the quality was very high. The only objection regards the coffee, as it was distributed from an automatic machine and only black coffee was free of charge. Cappuccino and the other variants were available on pay. However, the owners were extremely helpful and friendly. All in all, if you are travelling on a limited budget and want to stay in the most beautiful part of Berlin, well connected to the rest of the city, Astrid Hotel can be an excellent choice. I have described the room and hotel in finer detail to prevent surprises after the first impact, as later, the position of the hotel, price that you pay and the kindness of the owners make the stay pleasant and acceptable, if you do not have a double money for higher ranked hotels in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: brownali
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Astrid for 4 nights this August. We arrived very late at night and my initial reaction was not very positive. The dark entry way and poorly lit hallways were not inviting. However, the room, although small, was immaculate and very comfortable. The next morning, we realized how nice everything was. Breakfast is very good and the staff was more than accommodating. The neighborhood was wonderful, filled with beautiful shops and restaurants. Access to public transportation was excellent. If they put a light that stays on at night in the main entry way the hotel would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at Hotel Astrid - and I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ewaSweden
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for a few days in Berlin. Quiet nice street off Kudamm. Close to U-Bahn, S-Bahn, buses. One minute from the bus to the airport. Nice restaurants and jazz club (A-Trane) nearby. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Dovndyr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in 3 different rooms, first in a single room for only 35 Euros a night (aprox 45 US Dollars) wich was a bit small for a doubleroom, but plesent for one person, since the bed was a doublebed and everyhing was ok clean Then a friend came and we stayed at the hotels best room, a Junior Suite. This room was huge and had a nice balcony with view to the Kurfürstedamm, one of Berlin top shoppingstreets. This is one of the few rooms with a tube, and since its hardly is rentet i guess it had a funny smell in the beginning. The first day though the toilet was broken, so we got the key to the 4 bed room next door, wich also seemd ok for a niht ore two if you are some friends going to Berlin Every morning theres a nice breakfast, maybe not as big as of the Ritz - but hey, the breakfast alone would cost you the 35 Euros, so I think its pretty need. And the frontdeskstaff is quite nice, trying to help you in every way :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: zooks
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights Christmas 2010. After turning down first room offered (due to smell of smoke) were given great room at back of hotel overlooking garden. Couldn't fault the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff and the location is superb for walking (15 minutes) into the centre of Berlin. You must bear in mind that Berlin is a BIG City so it's debatable where the centre actually is! Convenient also for buses (2 mins) and trains (5 mins). There was always plenty of food at breakfast and also plenty of hot water. Weather outside was well below freezing but the hotel's heating system more then adequate. It's a jlittle jaded but worth it's 3* rating. Lots of good eating places close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: ikapl
Reviews.Content: very friendly and helpful staff; fast and economical bus connection to Tegel (€2.10 each way); great location on a side street off the Ku'damm (convenient to public transportation); our large room included 4 beds plus a pull-out couch; charming balcony; bathroom was rather small Our room had been very recently renovated and all furnishings were i very good shape. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Garni Astrid!

Reviews.Title: “If you're tired of Marriots...”
Reviews.Author: Henninglyn
Reviews.Content: If seek an old-fashioned atmosphere and you doesn't like mainsteam businesshotels, this is the right place in the mittle of West Berlin. Rooms, breakfast and service is basic, but you get what you pay for. There's a lot of cheep restaurants in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Old-fashioned, cheap, quiet hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jeff22London
Reviews.Content: Room was adequate (though safe did not work) but shower was a bit difficult to access. There was a reasonable selection for breakfast, including boiled eggs if you're not late. Staff were friendly, particularly the manageress who spoke decent English. Entrance is on the 1st floor up a long staircase but there is an antiquated lift. As others have said, it has an excellent location - take the S-bahn from Savignyplatz to Alexanderplatz to get a wonderful overview of the city. Our favourite restaurant was Lubitsch, several hundred metres towards the S-bahn in the same road as the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Bigbluedk
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is pretty close to perfect. The standard of the hotel is not very high, but neither is the price. In fact we just had to spend one night in Berlin on a budget and for that the hotel is perfect. The rooms were not very fancy but OK. Combined with the location (very safe neighborhood, by the way...), I think that it is very good value as long as you don't expect to find The Mariott or The Hilton. Breakfast was decent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: HansKGothenburg
Reviews.Content: Great value for money, a few meters of Ku-damm, one block from U-bahn, 2 blocks from S-bahn on a street with lots of restaurants. Small, clean "no frills" hotel with friendly staff. Only drawback is that some of the staff have very little command of english (not uncommon in Germany). Parking on the street outside was easy since we came in on a sunday but may be tricky otherwise. If you like us stay for a couple of nights to see Berlin and the hotel is just a sleeping place for a few hours a day then this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Astrid”
Reviews.Author: tarasproule
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our two children stayed for four nights in the Astrid Hotel Berlin. I was a bit worried after reading some not very good comments about it. We were expecting the worst but were more than happy with our stay. It is an old building and not very modern but when you get past the entrance the hotel was lovely. It is clean and comfortable with friendly staff and a great breakfast. It is in a great location with everything within walking distance. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, merely ok room”
Reviews.Author: JennyB74
Reviews.Content: The location is very good, on a quiet street just off Kurfurstendamm. Very close to both S-Savignyplatz and U-Uhlandstrasse. The staff is however not very friendly; I think they are Russian and therefore speaks very poor English. First we got a room that was ok but not completely cleaned. After a lot of argument about this with the owner (where none of us understood the other) we got another room, although he claimed from the beginning that he was fully booked....the new room was slightly better, but still had towels that were worn out, shabby toilet and pillows that practically was useless. The breakfast was good though: a lot of different things like bread, juice, youghurt, coffee, tea, tomato and mozzarella salad etc. If you just intend to sleep at the hotel and use it as a base from where you begin your vacation, it is totally ok. But if your intentions are to spend most of your time in it, choose something else.

HotelInfo.Name: Astrid Hotel am Kurfurstendamm
HotelInfo.Address: Bleibtreustrasse 20, 10623 Berlin, Germany
